post_title: It all began when Global Citizen announced the event on its website and across all social media platforms. Here‚Äôs a little video they shared on their Twitter handle:
post_content:
Join us on April 18 for One World: #TogetherAtHome, an event calling on leaders, corporations, philanthropists, and artists to step up the global fight against COVID-19. Learn more and take action with us here: https://t.co/QMSMOngS2h pic.twitter.com/12lgzOUPu1

— Global Citizen (@GlblCtzn) April 7, 2020
It‚Äôs so heartwarming to see the world come together for a cause!
sub_category: The line up for One World: Together At Home will definitely be keeping everyone at home
sub_category_description: A few weeks ago, Coldplay frontman Chris Martin played a 30-minute live social media concert with the goal to bring the world together, spread awareness, and raise funds. He then nominated others under the #TogetherAtHome challenge which led to legendary performances from other major artists. Now, Lady Gaga is taking it up a notch as she collaborates with the WHO to bring forward a well-curated panel of artists and healthcare experts under the umbrella of One World: Together At Home, a virtual concert aiming to raise funds for protective equipment for healthcare professionals working on the frontlines of this pandemic.

post_title: Lady Gaga, a stern advocate about social isolation and distancing, shared this heartfelt post on Twitter:
post_content:
üí™üíòüåà pic.twitter.com/4CiVyJMZZ9

— Lady Gaga (@ladygaga) March 14, 2020

— Jimmy Kimmel (@jimmykimmel) April 14, 2020

post_title: Paul McCartney, Stevie Wonder, and Billie Eilish will also be joining the parade of stars and celebrities:
post_content:
‚≠ïÔ∏è We‚Äôre excited to announce One World: #TogetherAtHome, a global broadcast on April 18, curated in collaboration with @LadyGaga and featuring your favorite artists and comedians ‚Äî all in support of the @WHO and healthcare workers on the frontlines of the COVID-19 crisis. (1/7) pic.twitter.com/ZspKXtmd2V

— Global Citizen (@GlblCtzn) April 6, 2020
Many more celebs will be participating in the One World: Together At Home concert on the 18th of April, 2020. The program will air as a global televised special on April 18 from 8 p.m. to 10 p.m. ET on NBC, CBS, and ABC in the United States. It will be broadcasted on the BBC network on April 19 from 7 p.m to 9 p.m in the UK. It will also be available to stream online across a variety of platforms, but all the timings have not been revealed yet, so make sure you stay tuned!
